entry.title: üöÄ What happens when FI, Logistics and Business One experts sit at one table?
entry.content:
A lot of laughter, some tough questions, and plenty of real project stories.

Last night‚Äôs SAP Stammtisch showed once again:
üëâ We don‚Äôt just talk about systems ‚Äì we share experiences, pain points and solutions.

Special thanks to Sabine Clemens for your sharp insights into the FI world ‚Äì with your depth and energy, any FI project can fly.
Big shout-out to our colleagues from Limassol Maxim Kulakov and Nizam Babayev for opening the B1 perspective ‚Äì great to learn from you and understand your processes.
And of course, thanks to Damla Toraman for making the evening smooth, fun, and interactive.

This is exactly why I love these sessions: we learn from each other, across modules, across backgrounds.

üí° Who‚Äôs in for the next round?

entry.title: Next-Level Demos: SAP Business One Localized Demo Databases are Updated and Available
entry.content:
We‚Äôre excited to share that the SAP Business One localized demo databases have been upgraded to the latest release, 10.0 FP 2508, and are now available for download!
This update includes fresh transactional data to ensure your demo environments look clean, current, and professional.

The localized demo databases offer a fully pre-configured SAP Business One setup across 39 localizations, based on the model company OEC Computers. They are available for both MS SQL and SAP HANA platforms.

Whether you're demonstrating, learning, teaching, or testing SAP Business One, this refreshed demo environment is designed to support your goals with greater clarity and realism.

Download the Localized Demo Databases for SAP Business One

entry.title: Your Feedback matters - fill out the SIS survey!
entry.content:
‚ÄãYour feedback on our support services is vital to us. By completing the SIS Survey, you help us enhance our service quality. When evaluating, please focus on these key points:

‚ÄãThe statement "SAP made it easy for me to handle my issue" should refer specifically to the support service provided in the current case that's being closed. Your evaluation should solely reflect the support given by the Support Engineer during this case, considering all obligations and limitations in service delivery.

‚ÄãIt's important to account for any limitations in SAP's support scope and the Partner's obligations, as outlined in the SAP Business One Maintenance Policy and Support Scope, and detailed in SAP Note 1162670. Cases categorized as consulting inquiries fall outside this scope and should not impact your rating of the support service you received.

‚ÄãPlease note that Support Engineers must adhere to established rules to avoid compliance issues and cannot provide support beyond SAP's defined scope.

‚ÄãSAP Support Management reviews all negatively rated (Strongly Disagree, Disagree) cases, and even neutrally rated ones (Neither Agree Nor Disagree) can provide valuable insights for service improvement. For this reason, we encourage you to fill in the "Please tell us the reason for your rating" textbox to help us understand the reasons behind any non-positive ratings.

‚ÄãIf your case was handled professionally and within the established support scope, we kindly ask you to acknowledge the Support Engineer's efforts by providing a positive rating (Strongly Agree) where applicable. Your feedback not only helps us improve but also motivates our team.

While we have your attention..

Keep an eye out for our highly successful webinar series, all the sessions are recorded and you will find both the recordings and the materials in the KBA ‚Äì 3525031 - Central KBA for Partner Enablement Sessions delivered by SAP Business One Support.

Short reminder about our Guided Answers. SAP Business One Support has of today released 42 different GAs. You will find all of them linked to the central KBA - 3213852 - Central KBA for SAP Business One Guided Answers

The Support Spotlight Blogs ‚Äì find them here: Tips from SAP Business One Support

entry.title: Automating SAP Business One Sales Reporting with n8n, AI, and Telegram
entry.content:
Introduction

This workflow integrates SAP Business One data through the Service Layer with Google Sheets and Telegram. The purpose of this workflow is to automate sales reporting process by automatically retrieving new sales orders, updating google sheets with new orders, and delivering daily summaries via Telegram. Google‚Äôs Gemma AI used in this workflow to add extra insights and analyze the consolidated data in order to highlighting top performers, upcoming due dates, and extracting sales trends by removing manual data exports and providing real-time visibility of sales performance.

 

Technical Architecture

The workflow includes two main stages. First, it connects to the Service Layer to retrieve sales orders data with the help of OData queries, filters out duplicates orders, and appends new orders to Google Sheets. Second, it uses JavaScript code to format the data, create structured AI prompts, and deliver the finalized reports through a Telegram Bot. (The social platfrom can be vary based on the user requirements.)

Prerequisites

  • SAP Business One Access: A valid database with authorized username, password, and active Service Layer. (SBODemoUS data used in this tutorial)
  • Docker: Docker Desktop used to deploy n8n.
  • Google Account: Google Sheets and Google API setup.
  • Telegram Account: A Telegram account to create a bot and obtain a user ID for notifications. (this can be applicable to any other platform)
  • n8n Account: n8n account for deploying and configuring workflows.
  • Javascript: JavaScript syntax used to in n8n nodes.

Implementation Steps

The workflow follows these stages:

  1. Deploying n8n on the server
  2. SAP Business One Integration
  3. Validate SAP Business One data
  4. Create automated workflow
  5. Google Sheets Data Synchronization
  6. Sales Analysis in Google Sheets
  7. AI-Powered Sales Insights
  8. Automated Reporting to Telegram

Implementation

The process starts by checking the latest sales orders in SAP Business One:

Next step is to deploy n8n in Docker and set up Service Layer using HTTP nodes for login and data retrieval. Example OData query would be like this:

https://server:50000/b1s/v1/Orders?$select=DocEntry,DocDate,CardName&$orderby=DocEntry desc&$top=10

A JavaScript code node also handles duplicate checking. It can grab existing rows from Google Sheets, pulls out DocEntry values, and filters SAP data to include only new sales orders. This prevent duplication when the workflow runs multiple times.

For having AI analysis, a JavaScript node formats the sales data into a prompt and calculates daily totals, identify top performers, and computes monthly averages. The prompt asks Gemma AI to generate a report with a performance summary, and alerts. Finally, the Telegram node sends the formatted report to specific user id, including the date, total sales, top performers, AI insights, and upcoming due dates.

Final Thoughts

This workflow automates sales order retrieval from SAP Business One through Service Layer and syncs new orders to Google Sheets. By using n8n, it delivers daily reports via Telegram and remove the need for manual data exports. The implementation requirements are SAP Business One Service Layer, Docker, n8n, and JavaScript to perform calculations with AI assistance. Although calculations can be done with just code, AI can help to get extra insights based on the given prompt. Beyond sales reporting, this approach can be applied to other modules such as purchasing, inventory management, or crm and making it a cost-effective alternative to enterprise automation platforms.

 

Resources 

The full guide is available as a PDF with step-by-step instructions and screenshots. The JavaScript code is in GitHub with comments.

  • Full Guide PDF
  • GitHub Repository

 

Prepared by

Amirhossein Tonekaboni
SAP Business One Consultant

  • LinkedIn
  • Portfolio

entry.title: Exploring UDV Enhancements (Part 2): Centralized UDV Management
entry.content:
This blog is the second in a two-part articles detailing the enhancements of the User-Defined Values (UDV) feature in SAP Business One 10.0 FP 2508 (the first one focuses on integrating APIs into formulas). Here, we explore a significant new feature: centralized management of UDV setups.

This feature enables you to manage all UDV setups from a single central place: the new ‚ÄúUser-Defined Values‚Äù app. You can find this app in the ‚ÄúAdministration‚Äù group in SAP Business One, Web client:

By choosing this tile, you can view a list of all UDV setups in your system. You can filer the list by various criteria, such as customization method:

UDV entries are organized by object names, providing a clear and comprehensive overview.

Key actions in this app:

  1. Create, edit, or delete UDV: you can easily create new UDV setups or modify and delete existing ones as needed
  2. Export/import UDV setups between companies: this feature enables you to export UDV setups from a base company and then import them into a target company. Visit the online help for more details.
  3. Copy UDV: select one or more UDV setups and copy them to another document within the same business module. For example, you can copy from sales orders to deliveries and A/R invoices within the same Sales module. More details can be found in the online help.

With the simplicity of this functionality, you can now speed up the implementation process of SAP Business One, making your workflows more efficient.

Watch the this video for a short demo of these capabilities (starting at 3:00).

entry.title: Exploring UDV Enhancements (Part 1): Using APIs in Formulas
entry.content:
After the first release of the User-Defined Values (UDV) feature in SAP Business One 10.0 FP 2502, the latest version, FP 2508, introduces 3 main enhancements:

  1. Support for new Business Objects: Business Partner master data and Activities
  2. Enhanced UDV Formulas with API Usage: ability to use APIs in UDV formulas, which is covered in this article
  3. UDV Management: ability to manage UDVs, which is covered in this article

In FP 2508, UDV formulas support 2 more types of components:

  • Global variables
  • Data manipulation APIs

Usage of global variables: assume that I‚Äôd like to show the user name that created a sales order in the ‚ÄúRemarks‚Äù field. For this purpose, I simply define the formula as follows:

If you want to access a list of all available global variables, use the ‚Äúapp‚Äù namespace. For information on all supported global variables, see our online help here.

Usage of data manipulation APIs: now, let‚Äôs assume that I want to see this user name in capital letters ‚Äì all I need to do is change the formula to:

Another useful type is conditional API: 'IF' statement. Assume that when the item quantity is greater than 100, I‚Äôd like to apply a 10% discount to the unit price. The formula will look like this:

This API provides 2 condition-based variants: the simple IF (if-else) and the complex IFS (IF statement with many conditions, similar to the ‚Äúswitch‚Äù keyword in programming language).

To discover many more string and mathematical manipulation APIs, visit our online help here.

To deepen your understanding, watch this short video for another use case.

By incorporating these enhancements, you can leverage SAP Business One more effectively, optimizing processes and increasing flexibility in data handling.

entry.title: This article explains the basic Idea and Architecture of SAP BODS
entry.content:
Understanding of SAP BODS?

SAP BODS stands for Business Objects Data Services.

It‚Äôs a tool used to extract data from different systems, transform it into useful information, and load it into a data warehouse.

In short, it helps combine and clean data so that organizations can make better decisions.

It supports data integration, data quality, data processing, and data profiling all in one platform.

Brief History of SAP BODS

  • In 2002, a company called BusinessObjects took over Acta‚Äôs tools and rebranded them as BusinessObjects Data Integration and BusinessObjects Data Quality.
  • In 2007, SAP acquired BusinessObjects, and the tools were renamed SAP BODI and SAP BODQ.
  • In 2008, SAP merged both products into one, which became SAP Business Objects Data Services (BODS) the tool we use today.

SAP BODS Architecture Overview

 

SAP BODS has several main components that work together:

 

                                                SAP BODS Architecture Diagram

 

  1. Repository

A repository is like a storage area that keeps all your project details such as metadata, source and target details, transformation rules, and objects created by users.

Each repository connects to one or more Job Servers which run the data jobs.

Repositories help share information with other systems and keep your data environment organized.

 

  1. Management Console

This is a web based tool used to monitor and manage jobs.

You can use it for:

  • Impact and Lineage Analysis
  • Administration and Auto Documentation
  • Operational Dashboards
  • Data Validation and Reporting

 

It gives you a complete overview of how your data flows and performs.

 

  1. Job Server

The Job Server runs your data movement and transformation processes.

It connects to multiple data sources, moves data in batch or real time, and handles extraction from ERP systems.

When you run a job from the Designer, the Job Server takes care of executing it.

 

  1. Data Services Designer

The Designer is where developers build and design jobs.

It has a graphical interface that allows you to drag and drop objects, define transformations, and control data flow.

It‚Äôs user friendly and helps you build workflows and manage repository metadata.

 

  1. Engines

Engines are the components that process your data once a job starts.

They handle extraction, transformation, and loading.

They are designed to perform tasks quickly using parallel processing and in memory transformations to improve speed and scalability.

 

  1. Access Server

This server handles real time messages.

It takes requests, routes them to the correct service, and returns the response within a set time.

This is useful when data needs to be updated instantly.

 

  1. Address Server

The Address Server helps in address validation and correction.

It must be running before executing any jobs that involve address cleansing or global address validation features.

Important Terms in SAP BODS

 

Datastore

A Datastore connects BODS to a data source, such as a database.

It lets you import metadata and provides the link between BODS and your backend system.

 

CMC (Central Management Console)

This is a web based admin tool where you can register repositories, manage users, and perform other administrative activities.

 

Data Integrator Web Administrator (DI Web Admin)

It helps manage repositories and services like job servers, meta repositories, and web services.

This tool keeps everything connected and maintained.

Advantages of SAP BODS

  • It provides high quality data profiling and supports data cleansing and transformation easily.
  • The user interface is simple and allows drag and drop functionality.
  • It‚Äôs quick to learn for beginners and efficient for developers.
  • You can build both batch and real time jobs.
  • It supports custom functions for complex data transformations.
  • It integrates well with SAP and non-SAP systems.

Disadvantages of SAP BODS

  • It‚Äôs expensive, especially for small companies.
  • It needs powerful hardware and sometimes multiple servers.
  • It requires a skilled development team to implement and manage.

Summary

 

SAP BODS is one of the most powerful tools for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL).

It allows organizations to connect to different systems, clean the data, and make it useful for reporting and analysis.

While it may cost more to set up, it offers strong performance, scalability, and flexibility for enterprise level data management.

                                                                                                                                                        Published by

                                                                                                                                                         Nikhat Fatima

entry.title: Lifecycle Management enhancements you don‚Äôt want to miss in SAP Business One SP 2511 !
entry.content:
If you administrate SAP Business One systems or handle lifecycle management operations - this one‚Äôs for you !

The latest Support Package (SP 2511) brings meaningful upgrades across Lifecycle Management, strengthening identity management, refining security, and simplifying system operations.

Here‚Äôs a quick roundup of what‚Äôs new:

Identity & Authentication Management (IAM)

The Identity and Authentication Management guide now includes two key updates designed to make authentication more seamless and secure:

  • Principal Propagation via Azure Apps
    SAP Business One now supports authentication of user context coming from Microsoft Azure based applications. The propagated identity is securely passed into SAP Business One, allowing partner applications to access system resources without additional sign-ins. 
    üìñ  To learn more about Principal Propagation via Azure Apps, refer to this chapter under Identity and Authentication Management guide
  • Single Sign-On with AD FS
    Ever wished you could sign in to the Web Client using your Windows SSO?
    Users with Active Directory Federation Service (AD FS) accounts can now enable SSO by configuring browsers to use Windows Integrated Authentication, making the login experience faster and frictionless. 
    üìñ  For step-by-step instructions, see the dedicated     chapter under Identity and Authentication Management guide



Server Tools: Dedicated Tomcat Instances
As the saying goes, ‚ÄúGood things come in small packages"...In this case, separating Tomcat instances means smoother restarts, fewer conflicts, and a faster SAP Business One backend.
SP 2511 introduces a modular Tomcat architecture for core components, allowing each service to be restarted or redeployed independently for greater flexibility and uptime.
Here's the breakdown for component configuration in SP 2511:

  • For SAP Business One (MS SQL)

    Component / ServiceDefault Port Description
    SAP Business One Server Tools Service (64-bit)40000

    Hosts System Landscape Directory (SLD) and Extension Manager 

    SAP Business One License Service (64-bit)40002Dedicated Instance for License Service
    SAP Business One Job Service (64-bit)40004Runs Job Service (and embedded MS365 Integration)
    ‚ÑπÔ∏è   You need to update the redirect URI for Microsoft 365 Integration after upgrading SAP Business One to 10.0 SP 2511 as Microsoft 365 Integration is installed with Job Service.
    SAP Business One Service Layer Controller (64-bit)40005Runs Mobile Service and Service Layer Configuration Manager
    ‚ÑπÔ∏è  This change applies exclusively to the Service Layer Configuration Manager. The port numbers for the Service Layer Load Balancer and Service Layer Nodes remain unchanged

  • For SAP Business One (Version for HANA)

    Component / ServiceDefault Port Description
    sapb1servertools.service40000

    Hosts System Landscape Directory (SLD), Extension Manager and Backup Service

    sapb1servertools-license.service40002Dedicated Instance for License Service
    sapb1servertools-analytics.service
    		40003Runs Analytics Service
    sapb1servertools-jobservice.service40004Runs Job Service (and embedded MS365 Integration)
    ‚ÑπÔ∏è   You need to update the redirect URI for Microsoft 365 Integration after upgrading SAP Business One to 10.0 SP 2511 as Microsoft 365 Integration is installed with Job Service.
    sapb1servertools-servicelayercontroller.service40005Runs Mobile Service and Service Layer Configuration Manager
    ‚ÑπÔ∏è  This change applies exclusively to the Service Layer Configuration Manager. The port numbers for the Service Layer Load Balancer and Service Layer Nodes remain unchanged

‚ÑπÔ∏è  Note:
During installation (or upgrade from versions earlier than SP 2511), port numbers can be configured directly in the setup wizard via dedicated panes or during reconfigure.
Make sure to review and adjust your network, firewall, and high-availability settings to match the new port configuration.
(As part of this restructuring, the default port for License Manager and License Control Center is updated from 40000 to 40002.
Administrators configuring high availability need to adjust settings to ensure seamless integration with the new setup).



Platform Matrix Updates
Here's what's new under supported Matrix for SAP Business One (MSSQL and Version for HANA):

Newly supported:

  • Microsoft Windows Server 2025
  • SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 15 SP7 (x86_64)
  • SAP HANA Enterprise Edition 2.0 SPS 08 Revision 087 (SAP HANA Client Version 2.25.31)

No longer supported:

  • SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 15 SP4 

‚ÑπÔ∏è  Note: 
SAP Business One Cloud 1.1 PL21 doesn‚Äôt support SAP HANA Enterprise Edition 2.0 SPS 08 Revision 087.



Security Hardening
(Applicable for users that log in to SAP Business One with a company user account - not an IDP account).

By now, you‚Äôve probably noticed the "Refresh"  button under the "Choose/Create Company"  window is gone and you might be wondering why. The reason is simple: it‚Äôs all about keeping things safe and controlled!

Here's how it works; If a company database is restored directly on the database server (outside of SAP Business One), it‚Äôs now up to the Landscape administrator to refresh the company list centrally via System Landscape Directory (SLD). This ensures that only authorized users can make newly restored companies visible under "Choose/Create Company"  window, reducing unnecessary exposure of system information before users are authenticated.

Internal operations triggered from within SAP Business One, such as company creation, upgrades, or year-end transfers, automatically refresh the company list as part of the workflow, so no additional action required in these scenarios.



Summary

SP 2511 brings smarter IAM, a more flexible modular Tomcat setup, expanded platform support, and tighter security for company databases - all designed to make managing SAP Business One smoother, safer, and more effective in your day-to-day operations.

Thanks for reading this roundup of SP 2511 lifecycle management updates! Hope you find these features valuable and enjoy putting them to work in your daily operations.

entry.title: Joule Studio for SAP Business One Customers and Partners
entry.content:
Hello everyone

We are living in fascinating times, AI is showing us a new path, and this blog aims to guide you in incorporating Joule into your SAP Business One options.

What are the requirements for using Joule?

1) You need a Joule Base license, which is free and can be obtained here: Joule Base princing 

2) You also need a Developer license for SAP Build (cloud TDD SAP Build developer 8019951), which can be obtained here: SAP Build pricing 

3) Finally, you require a Runtime license for SAP Build (cloud TDD SAP Build runtime 8019913), which can be obtained from the same link as in point 2.

13/11/2025 - Important update: I've verified that Partners can use SAP Build under the Pay-As-You-Go business model for testing, demos, and development. The Discovery Center indicates that it's free up to a certain number of users and usage.

Discovery Center 

Conclusion: Use this Pay-As-You-Go item for SAP BTP for cloud TDD (8009282).

If you have any questions, please consult your Channel Manager.

This is the first step, whether you are an SAP Customer or Partner, you must subscribe to these services, I recommend following this order:

First, subscribe to one Developer license and one Runtime license (Capacity Units). This is sufficient to get started.

This activates the creation of your SAP Business Technology Platform Global Account. You will receive a welcome email when it is ready.

Then, after receiving the SAP BTP welcome email, proceed to subscribe to the Joule Base license.

In short, the process is as follows:

At this point, you should already have all the necessary licenses to build your first projects with Joule Studio.

In an upcoming blog post, I'll explain how to configure your SAP BTP Global Account so you can then start using Joule Studio.

Best regards,

Erick G√≥mez

entry.title: One central learning page is now available for the entire SAP Business One community and friends!
entry.content:
No more searching across platforms, emails, or bookmarks ‚Äî visit our dedicated SAP Business One page on learning.sap.com for all your training needs:

  • SAP Business One TB courses
  • Web client training
  • Developing extensions courses
  • Certification opportunities and updates
  • And much more ‚Äî stay tuned for regular updates!

The training is public and free. The courses are translated. Spread the word! 

If you like to track your progress, complete quizzes and earn a public badge you would also need to register. 

And don‚Äôt forget ‚ÄòMi casa es su casa‚Äô so make our SAP Business One learning page your homepage.

Important: SAP Business One training programs on SAP Learning Hub will be retired on December 15, 2025. From now on, please use the new SAP Business One page at learning.sap.com as your reference.

entry.title: How Joule Connects to SAP Business One - Actions
entry.content:
Joule Studio's capabilities allow it to connect to a data source, in our case SAP Business One, thanks to Actions, and this is a central and fundamental concept.

Actions in SAP Build are components that allow you to Create, Read, Update or Delete (CRUD) data through Destinations, which in turn connect to the Service Layer.

If you want to delve deeper into Actions, I recommend the following link: ODATA - Actions 

Currently, Actions can be created using the OpenAPI Specification 3.0, but this doesn't yet exist for the SAP Business One Service Layer. It has been documented in a requirement that you can find at this link: https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/311258 

However, we can create Actions from scratch. This requires a solid understanding of how to use the SAP Service Layer, as well as access to it.

I'll explain how they are created, tested, and consumed using Joule Studio's skills; if you master this, you'll be ready to move forward.

Step 1

Direct link: https://youtu.be/3vmdXuFYenM?si=wfnTwnZMpxm5R1g3 

Step 2

Now that we have the Action published, we go to the Joule Studio skill, add it, and configure the input we added, this will make Joule ask the user for the Service call number.

If the response is successful, Joule will be able to answer the user's queries, I'll explain this in another post.

Best regards.

Erick G√≥mez
